solution_line_template: Andrew’s guest bedroom took {bedroom_planks} - {guest_bedroom_fewer} = <<{bedroom_planks}-{guest_bedroom_fewer}={guest_bedroom_planks}>>{guest_bedroom_planks} wooden planks.

In two bedrooms, he ruined {ruined_per_bedroom} planks each, so the bedrooms took an extra {ruined_per_bedroom} * {num_bedrooms_ruined} = <<{ruined_per_bedroom}*{num_bedrooms_ruined}={extra_bedroom_planks}>>{extra_bedroom_planks} planks.

In all, he used {bedroom_planks} + {living_room_planks} + {kitchen_planks} + {guest_bedroom_planks} + {hallway_planks} + {extra_bedroom_planks} = <<{bedroom_planks}+{living_room_planks}+{kitchen_planks}+{guest_bedroom_planks}+{hallway_planks}+{extra_bedroom_planks}={total_used}>>{total_used} planks for his whole house.
Andrew had {leftover_planks} leftover planks, so he bought {total_used} + {leftover_planks} = <<{leftover_planks}+{total_used}={total_bought}>>{total_bought} wooden planks to start with.
